meanings.sent1: Every morning, she beclothes herself in her favorite outfit.
meanings.sent2: He beclothes himself in warm layers before going out in the snow.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to beclothes itself with a tiny sock, looking quite silly.
meanings.sent4: The fog beclothes the city, hiding its tall buildings from view.
meanings.sent5: The superhero quickly beclothes himself in his costume to save the day.

meanings.sent1: The kind organization beclothes families in need during the winter.
meanings.sent2: Parents beclothe their children in new clothes for the school year.
meanings.sent3: The elves beclothe Santa in his iconic red suit every Christmas.
meanings.sent4: The trees beclothe the forest floor with a carpet of colorful leaves.
meanings.sent5: The shopkeeper beclothes the mannequin in the latest fashion trends.

meanings.sent1: The snowstorm beclothes the town in a blanket of white.
meanings.sent2: The knight beclothes himself in armor before battle.
meanings.sent3: The magician beclothes the rabbit in a tiny top hat for the trick.
meanings.sent4: The darkness beclothes the room, making it hard to see.
meanings.sent5: The artist beclothes the canvas with vibrant colors, creating a masterpiece.
